notes.note:
Performance improvements, including:

* Rendering graphics for Windows users by using [Off-Main-Thread Painting (OMTP)][0]
* Loading pages faster by changing how [Firefox caches and retrieves JavaScript][1]

[0]: https://mozillagfx.wordpress.com/2017/12/05/off-main-thread-painting/
[1]: https://blog.mozilla.org/javascript/2017/12/12/javascript-startup-bytecode-cache/

Improvements to Firefox Screenshots:

* Copy and paste screenshots directly to your clipboard
* Firefox Screenshots now works in Private Browsing mode

*In case you missed it*—57 Release privacy and performance feature:
Users can [enable Tracking Protection at all times][1]. Learn how to [turn Tracking Protection on][2].


[1]: https://blog.mozilla.org/blog/2018/01/23/latest-firefox-quantum-release-now-available-with-new-features
[2]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/tracking-protection#w_how-to-turn-tracking-protection-on

User profiles created in Firefox 58 (and in future releases) are not supported in previous versions of Firefox. Users who downgrade to a previous version should create a new profile for that version. Learn about [alternatives to downgrading][0] on our support site.

[0]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/install-older-version-of-firefox

Added a warning to alert users and site owners of planned security changes to sites affected by the [gradual distrust plan][0] for the [Symantec certificate authority][1]

[0]: https://wiki.mozilla.org/CA/Upcoming_Distrust_Actions
[1]: https://blog.mozilla.org/security/2017/10/31/statement-digicerts-proposed-purchase-symantec/

Added [PerformanceResourceTiming.workerStart][0] so sites can measure service worker startup time

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/PerformanceResourceTiming/workerStart
Fonts installed in non-standard directories will no longer appear blank for Linux users

Users running Firefox for Windows over a Remote Desktop Connection (RDP) may find that audio playback is disabled due to increased security restrictions. [Learn how to mitigate this issue][1] until it is corrected in an upcoming release.


  [1]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/i-cant-play-audio-remote-desktop-connection

Users running certain screen readers may experience performance issues and are advised to [use Firefox ESR][0] until performance issues are resolved in an upcoming future release

[0]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/can-i-use-my-screen-reader-new-firefox

When using certain non-default security policies on Windows 10 Fall Creators Update, e.g. with Windows Defender Exploit Protection or some Webroot security products, Firefox may fail to load pages ([bug 1433065][0]).

[0]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/1433065

system_requirements:
## Windows

### Operating Systems (32-bit and 64-bit)
 - Windows 7
 - Windows 8
 - Windows 10

### Recommended Hardware
-  Pentium 4 or newer processor that supports SSE2
-  512MB of RAM / 2GB of RAM for the 64-bit version
-  200MB of hard drive space

---

## Mac

### Operating Systems
- macOS 10.9
- macOS 10.10
- macOS 10.11
- macOS 10.12
- macOS 10.13

### Recommended Hardware
- Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 processor
- 512 MB of RAM
- 200 MB hard drive space

---

## GNU/Linux

### Software Requirements

*Please note that GNU/Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*

- Firefox will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    - GTK+ 3.4 or higher
    - GLib 2.22 or higher
    - Pango 1.14 or higher
    - X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
    - libstdc++ 4.6.1 or higher
- For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    - NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    - DBus 1.0 or higher
    - GNOME 2.16 or higher
    - PulseAudio

  [1]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/get-latest-version-firefox-windows-xp-vista
text:
With this release, we’re building on the great foundation provided by our [all-new Firefox Quantum browser][0]. We're optimizing the performance gains we released in 57 by improving the way we render graphics and cache JavaScript. We also made functional and privacy improvements to Firefox Screenshots. On Firefox for Android, we’ve added support for Progressive Web Apps (PWAs) so you can add websites to your home screen and use them like native apps.

Thank you to all of the [new Mozillians][1] who contributed to this release of Firefox!

[0]: https://blog.mozilla.org/blog/2017/11/14/introducing-firefox-quantum/
[1]: https://blog.mozilla.org/community/2018/01/17/firefox-58-new-contributors/
title: Firefox 58.0 Release
